text.section: A person who willfully or with the intent to evade payment of a tax under this article or to prevent the collection of a tax under this article fails to provide information as required under this article or provides false or misleading information is guilty of a misdemeanor and, on conviction, is subject to a fine not exceeding $5,000 or imprisonment not exceeding 18 months or both.
A prosecution under this section does not bar a prosecution for perjury.

This section does not apply to:
the alcoholic beverage tax;
the Maryland estate tax; or
the Maryland generation-skipping transfer tax.
